service_links.description: Links that every service should get automatically

serviceLinks.description: Links that every service should get automatically

pre_push_tasks.description: Tasks to inject in the pipeline, before the push of the service instance depending on this capability Custom tasks will automatically have env vars from `env` above injected. When multiple service instances reference the same capability instance, the tasks are deduped and injected before the push of the first service instance in the pipeline.

prePushTasks.description: Tasks to inject in the pipeline, before the push of the service instance depending on this capability Custom tasks will automatically have env vars from `env` above injected. When multiple service instances reference the same capability instance, the tasks are deduped and injected before the push of the first service instance in the pipeline.

inlined.description: either inline capability config definition, or reference a CapabilityInstanceDefinition on the top level application object

prodvana.common_config.BlobParameterDefi.title: Blob Parameter Definition
prodvana.common_config.BlobParameterDefi.description: A parameter pointing to a remote blob, stored inside Prodvana's BlobsManager interface. The value of the template variable will be the blob ID. When combined with `pvn-wrapper exec --in`, this parameter type can be used to make files manifest on disk.

branch.description: branch to pull commits from, defaults to `main`

default_tag.description: can be omitted if parameter is required

defaultTag.description: can be omitted if parameter is required

raw_secret.description: Raw secret value to be used for user-editable YAML and RPC calls.

rawSecret.description: Raw secret value to be used for user-editable YAML and RPC calls.

kubernetes_secret.description: Kubernetes secret, only works for Kubernetes runtimes.

kubernetesSecret.description: Kubernetes secret, only works for Kubernetes runtimes.

release_name.description: optional release name, leave blank to have Prodvana generate one. Mainly useful for migrating an existing helm release into Prodvana.

releaseName.description: optional release name, leave blank to have Prodvana generate one. Mainly useful for migrating an existing helm release into Prodvana.

namespace.description: used internally by Prodvana, do not set.

fixup_ownership.description: Before running helm commands, first fixup labels and annotations of the Kubernetes objects to match the expected state. This is useful for migrating an existing Kubernetes object to be managed by Helm.

fixupOwnership.description: Before running helm commands, first fixup labels and annotations of the Kubernetes objects to match the expected state. This is useful for migrating an existing Kubernetes object to be managed by Helm.

container_registry_id.description: both container_registry_id and container_registry are supported, but only set one not both

containerRegistryId.description: both container_registry_id and container_registry are supported, but only set one not both

image_repository.description: Not the URL, everything after: username/reponame leaving it as once field because the spec considers it 1 field in theory you can have no username, or nest the repo names

imageRepository.description: Not the URL, everything after: username/reponame leaving it as once field because the spec considers it 1 field in theory you can have no username, or nest the repo names

target.description: filter to a specific Kubernetes object. Omit to apply to all objects.

group.description: omit any of these fields to match all values

path.description: Specify a path to a local file or directory

paths.description: cannot be set in conjunction with path or tarball_blob_id Specify multiple paths. They will get concatenated.

sub_path.description: A sub_path relative to path containing the actual config. sub_path value can be templated, e.g. `{{.Builtins.ReleaseChannel.Name}}`. if specified, path must also be specified and be a directory.

subPath.description: A sub_path relative to path containing the actual config. sub_path value can be templated, e.g. `{{.Builtins.ReleaseChannel.Name}}`. if specified, path must also be specified and be a directory.

exclude_patterns.description: Used in conjunction with sub_path to exclude sub paths from being tarball'ed and uploaded to Prodvana. Follows the same format as gitignore.

excludePatterns.description: Used in conjunction with sub_path to exclude sub paths from being tarball'ed and uploaded to Prodvana. Follows the same format as gitignore.

include_patterns.description: If set, only include files that match this pattern. If not set, include all files not explicitly excluded.

includePatterns.description: If set, only include files that match this pattern. If not set, include all files not explicitly excluded.

config_override.description: will default to application's notification config

configOverride.description: will default to application's notification config

channel.description: catch all channel that will recieve all types of notifications

error_channel.description: this channel will only recieve error/failure notifications

errorChannel.description: this channel will only recieve error/failure notifications

name.description: must match a program in top-level program config

image.description: If present, overrides main program config. TODO: If users need to enforce that different RCs require different images, add requires_separate_images option to ProgramConfig. This will prevent accidentally undoing separate images via the UI or autopush.

image_registry_info.description: optional, not guaranteed to be compatible with `image` (e.g. if user decides to paste in a public image string)

imageRegistryInfo.description: optional, not guaranteed to be compatible with `image` (e.g. if user decides to paste in a public image string)

target_port.description: optional, default to the same value as `port`

targetPort.description: optional, default to the same value as `port`

external.description: if this port should be exposed to the public internet

tls.description: if the connection should use TLS

image_registry_info.description: optional, not guaranteed to be compatible with `image` (e.g. if user decides to paste in a public image string)

imageRegistryInfo.description: optional, not guaranteed to be compatible with `image` (e.g. if user decides to paste in a public image string)

ports.description: empty list is ok, default from docker image will be used

template_complete.description: Only set when this ServiceConfig represents a ServiceTemplate When set, this program will be added in whole to the target service's programs in full, and will not partially apply to a program with the same name in the target service's config.

templateComplete.description: Only set when this ServiceConfig represents a ServiceTemplate When set, this program will be added in whole to the target service's programs in full, and will not partially apply to a program with the same name in the target service's config.

working_directory.description: working directory, defaults to runtime's implementation (usually the default working directory in the docker image)

workingDirectory.description: working directory, defaults to runtime's implementation (usually the default working directory in the docker image)

prodvana.common_config.ProgramConfig.title: Program Config
prodvana.common_config.ProgramConfig.description: This ProgramConfig is used in multiple places, including service configuration and custom pipeline tasks. The validations expressed here represent the lowest common denominator of the use cases.

bypass_settings.description: customize what is bypassed in the fast releases (the default for rollbacks). Defaults to everything being bypassed.

bypassSettings.description: customize what is bypassed in the fast releases (the default for rollbacks). Defaults to everything being bypassed.

tarball_blob_id.description: A directory tarball blob id uploaded to prodvana.  TODO(naphat) git repo support?

tarballBlobId.description: A directory tarball blob id uploaded to prodvana.  TODO(naphat) git repo support?

prodvana.common_config.RemoteConfig.title: Remote Config
prodvana.common_config.RemoteConfig.description: a remote config, specified by a remote source and a subpath

repo.description: TODO(naphat) add integration support for private repositories

kubernetes_secret.description: Kubernetes secret, only works for Kubernetes runtimes.

kubernetesSecret.description: Kubernetes secret, only works for Kubernetes runtimes.

prodvana.common_config.SecretReferenceVa.title: Secret Reference Value
prodvana.common_config.SecretReferenceVa.description: only works for Kubernetes Runtimes or for Runtimes whose proxy Runtime is Kubernetes

ttl.description: TTL after the job completes, defaults to 1 hour.

retry_config.description: If not set, the task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

retryConfig.description: If not set, the task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

canary_weight.description: weight to advance canary to, percentage 0-100

canaryWeight.description: weight to advance canary to, percentage 0-100

duration.description: duration to pause at this weight before advancing

canary_progress.description: progression of canary as delivery occurs

canaryProgress.description: progression of canary as delivery occurs

env.description: optional env variables to inject and override from exec_config

shared_instance_key.description: a string used to de-duplicate instances of the same delivery extension. by building this string with the parameters that make this instance unique, Prodvana will ensure only one instance of this delivery extension is created and it will be used to satisfy all references with this same key. By default this will be set to the name of the release channel that the delivery extension will be executed in.

sharedInstanceKey.description: a string used to de-duplicate instances of the same delivery extension. by building this string with the parameters that make this instance unique, Prodvana will ensure only one instance of this delivery extension is created and it will be used to satisfy all references with this same key. By default this will be set to the name of the release channel that the delivery extension will be executed in.

inherit_role_from_runtime_env.description: the ProxyRuntime has been configured with an IAM role that has the necessary permissions  TODO(naphat) assumeRole support

inheritRoleFromRuntimeEnv.description: the ProxyRuntime has been configured with an IAM role that has the necessary permissions  TODO(naphat) assumeRole support

k8s_service_account.description: optional, if the proxy runtime is an EKS cluster you can specify the K8S Service Account to use. If not passed, the default service account for the namespace will be used.

k8sServiceAccount.description: optional, if the proxy runtime is an EKS cluster you can specify the K8S Service Account to use. If not passed, the default service account for the namespace will be used.

prodvana.environment.AwsEcsConfig.Inheri.title: Inherit Role
prodvana.environment.AwsEcsConfig.Inheri.description: the ProxyRuntime has been configured with an IAM role that has the necessary permissions

self_managed_gke_ingress.description: Self-Managed GKE Ingress - exposes configuration options for GKE Ingress but does not create an ingress object for you

selfManagedGkeIngress.description: Self-Managed GKE Ingress - exposes configuration options for GKE Ingress but does not create an ingress object for you

extension.description: deprecated, use custom which means the same thing

terraform_runner.description: terraform runner is a runtime that runs terraform via k8s jobs

terraformRunner.description: terraform runner is a runtime that runs terraform via k8s jobs

pulumi_runner.description: pulumi runner is a runtime that runs pulumi via k8s jobs

pulumiRunner.description: pulumi runner is a runtime that runs pulumi via k8s jobs

default_balancer_attributes.description: Attributes from https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/application-load-balancers.html#load-balancer-attributes that are added to all Ingresses/LBs created in this runtime.

defaultBalancerAttributes.description: Attributes from https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/application-load-balancers.html#load-balancer-attributes that are added to all Ingresses/LBs created in this runtime.

arg_mapping.description: template argument name to prodvana value to inject

argMapping.description: template argument name to prodvana value to inject

container_native.description: Enables container native load balancing, allowing GCP LBs to target k8s pods directly. See: https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/container-native-load-balancing

containerNative.description: Enables container native load balancing, allowing GCP LBs to target k8s pods directly. See: https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/container-native-load-balancing

env.description: optional env variables to inject and override from exec_config

retry_policy.description: used in conjunction with retryable_exit_codes, defaults to the convergence grace period

retryPolicy.description: used in conjunction with retryable_exit_codes, defaults to the convergence grace period

retryable_exit_codes.description: if set and the apply command returns these exit codes, retry the command without marking the result as failing.

retryableExitCodes.description: if set and the apply command returns these exit codes, retry the command without marking the result as failing.

max_concurrency.description: optional, if set, do not run more than this many apply commands concurrently

maxConcurrency.description: optional, if set, do not run more than this many apply commands concurrently

debug.description: deprecated, set this as get_info instead

require_approval_before_apply.description: Apply is potentially dangerous - require approval before each apply

requireApprovalBeforeApply.description: Apply is potentially dangerous - require approval before each apply

convergence_grace_period.description: How long after apply ran the first time should it be restarted if the service still has not converged. This duration is computed from the *start* of apply run. Defaults to 10m.

convergenceGracePeriod.description: How long after apply ran the first time should it be restarted if the service still has not converged. This duration is computed from the *start* of apply run. Defaults to 10m.

poll_interval.description: customize intervals instead of using Prodvana default only used for fetch how often to run command after it succeeds

pollInterval.description: customize intervals instead of using Prodvana default only used for fetch how often to run command after it succeeds

steady_state_poll_interval.description: how often to fetch when in steady state (after the extension has converged)

steadyStatePollInterval.description: how often to fetch when in steady state (after the extension has converged)

retry_policy.description: retry policy for unexpected failures (this means exits other than 0 or 2 when fetch_mode = EXIT_CODE, or other than 0 for STRUCTURED_OUTPUT). if not set, regular, non-steady-state poll interval is used for fetches.

retryPolicy.description: retry policy for unexpected failures (this means exits other than 0 or 2 when fetch_mode = EXIT_CODE, or other than 0 for STRUCTURED_OUTPUT). if not set, regular, non-steady-state poll interval is used for fetches.

env.description: optional env variables to inject and override from exec_config

poll_interval.description: customize intervals instead of using Prodvana default defaults to 5 minutes

pollInterval.description: customize intervals instead of using Prodvana default defaults to 5 minutes

retry_policy.description: retry policy for unexpected failures. defaults to fast retrying after 30s then backing off to 10 minutes

retryPolicy.description: retry policy for unexpected failures. defaults to fast retrying after 30s then backing off to 10 minutes

env.description: optional env variables to inject and override from exec_config

test_only_do_not_require_pvn_wrapper.description: exposed for internal testing. do not set

testOnlyDoNotRequirePvnWrapper.description: exposed for internal testing. do not set

service_account_json.description: TODO(naphat) support for job service account name

serviceAccountJson.description: TODO(naphat) support for job service account name

env.description: optional env variables to pass to terraform commands, can be useful for passing secrets

volumes.description: optional volumes to mount into terraform containers

pre_run.description: commands that must run before terraform can run, e.g. gcloud auth login

preRun.description: commands that must run before terraform can run, e.g. gcloud auth login

poll_interval.description: Poll interval for terraform plan when not converged, defaults to 5 minutes. Polling takes a lock on terraform state file, so increase this if you run terraform plan locally often.

pollInterval.description: Poll interval for terraform plan when not converged, defaults to 5 minutes. Polling takes a lock on terraform state file, so increase this if you run terraform plan locally often.

steady_state_poll_interval.description: Poll interval for terraform plan in steady state (after it has converged), defaults to 1 hour. During steady state, polling is used for drift detection. This is the min duration of time for which drift not being detected is OK.

steadyStatePollInterval.description: Poll interval for terraform plan in steady state (after it has converged), defaults to 1 hour. During steady state, polling is used for drift detection. This is the min duration of time for which drift not being detected is OK.

require_approval_before_apply.description: Require approval before every apply operation - this is on top of any release channel-level approvals.

requireApprovalBeforeApply.description: Require approval before every apply operation - this is on top of any release channel-level approvals.

fetch_retry_policy.description: override default retry policy. Default is min = 1m, max = 15m.

fetchRetryPolicy.description: override default retry policy. Default is min = 1m, max = 15m.

apply_retry_policy.description: override apply retry policy. Default is min = 30s, max = 5m.

applyRetryPolicy.description: override apply retry policy. Default is min = 30s, max = 5m.

disable_drift_detection.description: Skip drift detection. This is useful for faster convergence on updates, but can lead to drift going undetected. When enabled, steady state polling is turned off. NOTE: Only supported in Pulumi today.

disableDriftDetection.description: Skip drift detection. This is useful for faster convergence on updates, but can lead to drift going undetected. When enabled, steady state polling is turned off. NOTE: Only supported in Pulumi today.

task_resources.description: Resource constraints for the  runner's Fetch and Apply commands.

taskResources.description: Resource constraints for the  runner's Fetch and Apply commands.

service_account.description: optionally override what service account is used for terraform

serviceAccount.description: optionally override what service account is used for terraform

regions.description: if set, only manage these regions

description.description: description used for displaying this task

retry_config.description: if not set, the custom task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

retryConfig.description: if not set, the custom task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

application.description: TODO(naphat) is this the best interface, or do we just take runtime + namespace?

final_compiled_program.description: if set, treat the program as the final program, avoid any internal Prodvana compilation (e.g. setting default env from app config)

finalCompiledProgram.description: if set, treat the program as the final program, avoid any internal Prodvana compilation (e.g. setting default env from app config)

service_id.description: when passing as input, only specify one of service or service_id, not both

serviceId.description: when passing as input, only specify one of service or service_id, not both

release_channel_id.description: when passing as input, only specify one of release_channel or release_channel_id, not both

releaseChannelId.description: when passing as input, only specify one of release_channel or release_channel_id, not both

rollback.description: deprecated, set at pipeline level instead of task level

prodvana.pipelines.Task.Metadata.title: Metadata
prodvana.pipelines.Task.Metadata.description: Metadata contains information generic to all task types. Compilation of a task can be done entirely with its metadata and specific task-type config.

message.description: This protection will always fail, mainly used for Prodvana's internal testing.

prodvana.protection.AlwaysPassingProtect.title: Always Passing Protection Config
prodvana.protection.AlwaysPassingProtect.description: This protection will always pass, mainly used for Prodvana's internal testing.

lifecycle.description: if set, the attachment is automatically used in all deployments for the subject of this attachment. e.g. for release channels, all service instances in that release channel will use the attachment.

task_config.description: Inline task config with retry, template support.

taskConfig.description: Inline task config with retry, template support.

builtin.description: Other options here: - Ref to external repository of protection definitions.

poll_interval.description: customize intervals instead of using Prodvana default how often to run check even if it succeeds

pollInterval.description: customize intervals instead of using Prodvana default how often to run check even if it succeeds

pre_approval.description: NOTE: Type here must match CustomTaskType

preApproval.description: NOTE: Type here must match CustomTaskType

check_duration.description: How long after starting should we check for?

hours.description: Supports ranges (i.e. 10-20) and comma separated lists (i.e. 5,6,7,8) or a combination of the two

min_approvers.description: if set, a unique number of users must approve this precondition before the release channel can be deployed.

minApprovers.description: if set, a unique number of users must approve this precondition before the release channel can be deployed.

every_action.description: request approval on every apply action, not just the first. only works for runtime extensions, will do nothing for kubernetes services.

everyAction.description: request approval on every apply action, not just the first. only works for runtime extensions, will do nothing for kubernetes services.

min_approvers.description: if set, a unique number of users must approve this precondition before the release channel can be deployed.

minApprovers.description: if set, a unique number of users must approve this precondition before the release channel can be deployed.

allow_empty.description: if selector is used, allow selector to return an empty list of release channels

allowEmpty.description: if selector is used, allow selector to return an empty list of release channels

name.description: intentionally does not reference cluster - this allows us to copy release channels across clusters via the same config

group.description: if specified, this release channel is part of a group. This can affect how release channels are rendered on the Prodvana web interface.

maturity.title: Maturity
maturity.description: TODO(naphat) maturity likely should not be hardcoded but be flexible per organization

service_instance_protections.description: protections that all service instances in this release channel should get

serviceInstanceProtections.description: protections that all service instances in this release channel should get

constants.description: constants made available in template substitutions

disable_all_protections.description: Disable all protections for this release channel - protections will not be created for any service instances in this release channel. This is useful for release channels that are used for testing or are not yet in production (e.g., fast creation of new tenants).

disableAllProtections.description: Disable all protections for this release channel - protections will not be created for any service instances in this release channel. This is useful for release channels that are used for testing or are not yet in production (e.g., fast creation of new tenants).

runtime_selector.description: label selector for runtimes to generate release channels for. One release channel will be generated for each runtime that matches this selector. The selector will automatically be intersected with "@type=runtime".

runtimeSelector.description: label selector for runtimes to generate release channels for. One release channel will be generated for each runtime that matches this selector. The selector will automatically be intersected with "@type=runtime".

allow_empty.description: By default, if the runtime selector returns an empty list of runtimes, Prodvana will error out. Set allow_empty to true to explicitly allow the selector to return an empty list.

allowEmpty.description: By default, if the runtime selector returns an empty list of runtimes, Prodvana will error out. Set allow_empty to true to explicitly allow the selector to return an empty list.

template.description: optionally customize how the release channel will be generated. Template variables .Builtins.Group an d.Builtins.Runtime are available. Any value specified here will be merged with: name: {{.Builtins.Group}}-{{.Builtins.Runtime.Name}} group: {{.Builtins.Group}} runtimes: - runtime: {{Builtins.Runtime.Name}}

name.description: Optional identifier for this runtime connection within this release channel, useful if the release channel has multiple runtimes of the same type. Defaults to the value of `runtime``.

namespace.description: optionally set a custom namespace. If not set, Prodvana will create and manage the namespace. If set, the namespace *must* already exist and Prodvana will not try to create or delete it.

pvn_managed.description: do not set this, this is used internally by Prodvana to keep track of if a namespace is managed by Prodvana or externally.

pvnManaged.description: do not set this, this is used internally by Prodvana to keep track of if a namespace is managed by Prodvana or externally.

ecs_service_name_override.description: optional, defaults to Prodvana service name

ecsServiceNameOverride.description: optional, defaults to Prodvana service name

update_task_definition_only.description: Only update service's task definition, but do not try to update anything else about the service. This means that something else is responsible for creating the service.  if set, network_configuration cannot be set

updateTaskDefinitionOnly.description: Only update service's task definition, but do not try to update anything else about the service. This means that something else is responsible for creating the service.  if set, network_configuration cannot be set

inlined.description: Inline definition of a delivery extension.

instance.description: A delivery instance defined in this service config.

ref.description: Reference to a delivery extension defined externally.

dependencies.description: a list of other delivery extensions that must be executed before this one

inlined.description: Inline definition of the delivery extension.

ref.description: Reference to a delivery extension defined externally.

dependencies.description: a list of other delivery extensions that must be executed before this one

runtime_connection.description: which runtime connection to use in each release channel. optional if only one runtime makes sense for the service config.

runtimeConnection.description: which runtime connection to use in each release channel. optional if only one runtime makes sense for the service config.

external_config.description: deprecated, pass this as kubernetes_config instead

externalConfig.description: deprecated, pass this as kubernetes_config instead

env.description: Additional env variables that are injected to the service. This can be useful for injecting and/or overriding env variables from release channel configs for Kubernetes and runtime extension configs. Not supported for helm configs.

constants.description: constants made available in template substitutions

convergence_protections.description: TODO: unused today, but will be used for per-service per-RC convergence protections in the future

convergenceProtections.description: TODO: unused today, but will be used for per-service per-RC convergence protections in the future

path.description: the path to directory to run pulumi commands

pulumi_command_prefix.description: optional, prefix for all pulumi commands, for example [poetry, run]

pulumiCommandPrefix.description: optional, prefix for all pulumi commands, for example [poetry, run]

individual_stage_deadline.description: deadline in each stage before the push is rolled back. Includes the time it takes for pods to be healthy. Defaults to 10 minutes.

individualStageDeadline.description: deadline in each stage before the push is rolled back. Includes the time it takes for pods to be healthy. Defaults to 10 minutes.

automated_testing_duration.description: duration of the automated testing phase, before manual approval. Defaults to 30m.

automatedTestingDuration.description: duration of the automated testing phase, before manual approval. Defaults to 30m.

check_interval.description: advanced settings that do not typically need to be set. Exposed mainly for testing purposes.  defaults to 30s

checkInterval.description: advanced settings that do not typically need to be set. Exposed mainly for testing purposes.  defaults to 30s

fixed.description: no validations, server side has defaults

clear_on_per_release_channel_merge.description: can only be set on a PerReleaseChannel config. If set, parameter values will be replaced instead of joined.

clearOnPerReleaseChannelMerge.description: can only be set on a PerReleaseChannel config. If set, parameter values will be replaced instead of joined.

prodvana.service.RuntimeSpecificConfig.title: Runtime Specific Config
prodvana.service.RuntimeSpecificConfig.description: RuntimeSpecificConfig contains Service level configuration options that only make sense for a specific Runtime type. Configuration added here should only apply to a single Service; if the Runtime specific configuration relates to all services, it should be configured as at the Runtime cluster level (or as a runtime extension).

service_annotations.description: Annotations to add to the Kubernetes Service object

serviceAnnotations.description: Annotations to add to the Kubernetes Service object

convergence_protections.description: Convergence protections applied to all release channels.

convergenceProtections.description: Convergence protections applied to all release channels.

runtime_connection.description: which runtime connection to use in each release channel. optional if only one runtime makes sense for the service config.

runtimeConnection.description: which runtime connection to use in each release channel. optional if only one runtime makes sense for the service config.

parameter_values.description: only valid to set in compiled configs by Prodvana

parameterValues.description: only valid to set in compiled configs by Prodvana

constants.description: constants made available in template substitutions

progress_deadline.description: how long to wait before marking deployment as failed

progressDeadline.description: how long to wait before marking deployment as failed

external_config.description: deprecated, pass this as kubernetes_config instead

externalConfig.description: deprecated, pass this as kubernetes_config instead

no_cleanup_on_delete.description: if set, do not attempt to delete the underlying runtime objects when deleting a service

noCleanupOnDelete.description: if set, do not attempt to delete the underlying runtime objects when deleting a service

env.description: Additional env variables that are injected to the service. This can be useful for injecting and/or overriding env variables from release channel configs for Kubernetes and runtime extension configs. Not supported for helm configs.

bundle_name.description: optional, customize the name of the bundle that will be created for this service. By default, the bundle name is generated based on input parameters, such as commit hash. The bundle name cannot be different per Release Channel. Doing so is an error. If the generated bundle name already exists, a number will be appended to resolve conflict.

bundleName.description: optional, customize the name of the bundle that will be created for this service. By default, the bundle name is generated based on input parameters, such as commit hash. The bundle name cannot be different per Release Channel. Doing so is an error. If the generated bundle name already exists, a number will be appended to resolve conflict.

raw_secret.description: Raw secret value to be used for user-editable YAML and RPC calls.

rawSecret.description: Raw secret value to be used for user-editable YAML and RPC calls.

base_program.description: optional base program to take configs from. If specified, `program` field will act like an override instead.

baseProgram.description: optional base program to take configs from. If specified, `program` field will act like an override instead.

retry_config.description: if not set, the task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

retryConfig.description: if not set, the task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

ref.description: Instead of defining a new task, reference an existing custom task and use that. This is meant to be used in conjunection with per_release_channel to allow multiple release channels to use a single custom task. If set, the program definition is ignored except for program name.

path.description: the path to directory to run terraform commands

backend_config.description: optional, backend config to set for this run (the equivalent of passing --backend-config=key=value to `terraform init`)

backendConfig.description: optional, backend config to set for this run (the equivalent of passing --backend-config=key=value to `terraform init`)

prodvana.workflow.AnnotationsConfig.title: Annotations Config
prodvana.workflow.AnnotationsConfig.description: this is currently used only on the Release Channel level because Honeycomb's model means we map environment to a Release Channel Last9's model is configured at the Application level because it does not have a similar concept. It doesn't make sense to put Last9 config at the RC level or Honeycomb config at the Application level, so these are separate AnnotationConfig messages. See prodvana.application.AnnotationsConfig for Last9 config.
